subject: Self Care
title: Sleep Disorders Explained
description: A quick win: understand Sleep Disorders Explained.

hook.text: Over 70 million Americans have a sleep disorder. Most are undiagnosed and suffering in silence.

buildup.text: Insomnia, sleep apnea, restless legs, and narcolepsy are among the most common sleep disorders.

discovery.text: Sleep apnea alone affects 30 million adults. Breathing stops repeatedly, and oxygen levels plummet.

twist.text: Many disorders are treatable but require proper diagnosis. Toughing it out only makes things worse.

climax.text: If you consistently struggle to sleep despite good habits, a sleep study may reveal the real cause.

punchline.text: Chronic bad sleep isn't normal. Get it checked.

quiz.question: How many Americans are estimated to have a sleep disorder?
